org.jcvi.jillion.assembly.util

Interface CoverageRegion<T extends Rangeable>

  • Type Parameters:
    T - the type of Rangeable elements that make up this coverage region.
    All Superinterfaces:
    Iterable<T>, Rangeable

    public interface CoverageRegion<T extends Rangeable>
extends Rangeable, Iterable<T>
    A CoverageRegion is a contiguous portion of a CoverageMap which has exactly the same elements (and therefore the same depth of coverage). If any elements stop providing coverage or if new elements start providing coverage, then there will be multiple CoverageRegions.
    Author:
    dkatzel

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int getCoverageDepth()
      Get the coverage depth of this coverage region.
      long getLength()
      Get the length of this coverage region.
      Stream<T> streamElements()

      • Methods inherited from interface java.lang.Iterable

    • Method Detail

      • getCoverageDepth

        int getCoverageDepth()
        Get the coverage depth of this coverage region. which is the number of elements that make up this region.
        Returns:
        an integer >= 0.

      • getLength

        long getLength()
        Get the length of this coverage region. Should return the same value as the length from asRange().getLength().
        Specified by:
        getLength in interface Rangeable
        Returns:
        the length; will always be ≥ 0.
        See Also:
        Range.getLength()

      • streamElements

        Stream<T> streamElements()
